First aid information?: If swallowed, sip a glass of water if able to swallow. Do not induce vomiting unless told to do so by a poison control center or doctor. If inhaled, move to fresh air. If on skin or clothing, rinse skin immediately with plenty of water for 15-20 minutes. If in eyes, rinse slowly and gently with water for 15-20 minutes. Remove contact lenses, if present, after the first 5 minutes, then continue rinsing eye.
What special restrictions are placed on: Do not discharge effluent containing this product into lakes, streams, ponds, estuaries, oceans or other waters unless in accordance with the requirements of a National Pollutant Discharge Elimination System(NPDES) permit. Do not discharge effluent containing this product to sewer systems without previously notifying the local sewage treatment plant authority.
What PPE should I wear?: Disposable latex gloves, gowns, masks and splash resistant goggles must be worn when handling items soiled with blood or body fluids.
How does the product have to be stored o: Store in an area inaccessible to children. For containers 1 gallon or less, do not reuse or refill the container. Offer for recycling if available. Otherwise, wrap empty container in plastic bag and discard in trash. For containers over 1 gallon, do not contaminate water, food or feed by storage and disposal. Offer for recycling or reconditioning, or puncture and dispose of in a sanitary landfill, or incinerate, or if allowed by state and local authorities, burn.
